security: Several documents contain lists of names of individuals. The disclosure of these names could potentially violate their personal privacy.
summary: This collection of documents pertains to the FBI's responses to inquiries from various Congressional committees, including the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, regarding investigations, COINTELPRO, and related matters. It also includes details about security clearances for Senate Select Committee staff and an incident involving an FBI informant.
summary_one_paragraph: This file contains several memoranda and communications related to the FBI's interactions with Congressional committees in 1975. One memo discusses the FBI's response to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities regarding access to information on COINTELPRO and outlines a plan for assessing potential damage from disclosure. Another memo details compliance with requests from the House Judiciary Committee's Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights. Additionally, the file includes correspondence with Congressman Charles E. Wiggins concerning an FBI informant and a listing of security clearances for staff members of the Senate Select Committee. The documents also feature airtels from FBI field offices providing updates on specific investigations.
tags: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
title: Responses to Congressional Committee Requests and Related Matters
recipient: Mr. J. B. Adams, Director, FBI
